intro: Ceropegia merrillii, commonly known as the Cape fuchsia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and fleshy, succulent stems. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color, attracting specific pollinators such as bees and moths. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Its unique floral structure and adaptability to arid conditions make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
